      • getRouteByAddress

        public GeoRouteResponse getRouteByAddress(java.lang.String startAddress,
                                 java.lang.String endAddress,
                                 java.lang.String db,
                                 java.lang.String country,
                                 java.lang.String intermediateAddresses,
                                 java.lang.String oip,
                                 java.lang.String destinationSrs,
                                 java.lang.String optimizeBy,
                                 java.lang.String returnDistance,
                                 java.lang.String distanceUnit,
                                 java.lang.String returnTime,
                                 java.lang.String timeUnit,
                                 java.lang.String language,
                                 java.lang.String directionsStyle,
                                 java.lang.String segmentGeometryStyle,
                                 java.lang.String primaryNameOnly,
                                 java.lang.String majorRoads,
                                 java.lang.String historicTrafficTimeBucket,
                                 java.lang.String returnDirectionGeometry)
                                   throws ApiException
        Gets Route by Address Routing Directions for Single and Multiple Origin & Destination Inputs. Accepts addresses as input and Returns Point-to-Point and Multi-Point travel directions by various travel modes.
        Parameters:
        startAddress - Starting address of the route. (required)
        endAddress - Ending address of the route. (required)
        db - Mode of commute. (optional, default to driving)
        country - Three digit ISO country code (optional, default to USA)
        intermediateAddresses - List of intermediate addresses of the route. (optional)
        oip - Specifies whether waypoints need to be optimized. (optional, default to false)
        destinationSrs - Specifies the desired coordinate system of the returned route. (optional)
        optimizeBy - Specifies whether the route should be optimized by time or distance. (optional, default to time)
        returnDistance - Specifies whether distance needs to be part of direction information in response. (optional, default to true)
        distanceUnit - Return Distance Unit such as ft(Foot), km(Kilometer), mi(Mile), m(Meter) or yd(Yard). (optional, default to m)
        returnTime - Specifies whether time needs to be part of direction information in response. (optional, default to true)
        timeUnit - Return time unit such as min(Minute), h(Hour), s(Second) or msec(Millisecond). (optional, default to min)
        language - Language of travel directions. (optional, default to en)
        directionsStyle - Specifies whether route directions text is to be returned in the response and in what detail (Normal or Terse). (optional, default to None)
        segmentGeometryStyle - Specifies whether the route geometry is to be returned in the response and in what detail (End or All). (optional, default to none)
        primaryNameOnly - If true then only the primary street name is returned otherwise all the names for a street. (optional, default to false)
        majorRoads - Whether to include all roads in route calculation or just major roads. (optional, default to false)
        historicTrafficTimeBucket - Specifies whether routing calculation uses the historic traffic speeds. (optional, default to None)
        returnDirectionGeometry - Whether to include geometry associated with each route instruction in response. (optional, default to false)
        Returns:
        GeoRouteResponse
        Throws:
        ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

        Gets Route by Address Routing Directions for Single and Multiple Origin & Destination Inputs. Accepts addresses as input and Returns Point-to-Point and Multi-Point travel directions by various travel modes.
        Parameters:
        startAddress - Starting address of the route. (required)
        endAddress - Ending address of the route. (required)
        db - Mode of commute. (optional, default to driving)
        country - Three digit ISO country code (optional, default to USA)
        intermediateAddresses - List of intermediate addresses of the route. (optional)
        oip - Specifies whether waypoints need to be optimized. (optional, default to false)
        destinationSrs - Specifies the desired coordinate system of the returned route. (optional)
        optimizeBy - Specifies whether the route should be optimized by time or distance. (optional, default to time)
        returnDistance - Specifies whether distance needs to be part of direction information in response. (optional, default to true)
        distanceUnit - Return Distance Unit such as ft(Foot), km(Kilometer), mi(Mile), m(Meter) or yd(Yard). (optional, default to m)
        returnTime - Specifies whether time needs to be part of direction information in response. (optional, default to true)
        timeUnit - Return time unit such as min(Minute), h(Hour), s(Second) or msec(Millisecond). (optional, default to min)
        language - Language of travel directions. (optional, default to en)
        directionsStyle - Specifies whether route directions text is to be returned in the response and in what detail (Normal or Terse). (optional, default to None)
        segmentGeometryStyle - Specifies whether the route geometry is to be returned in the response and in what detail (End or All). (optional, default to none)
        primaryNameOnly - If true then only the primary street name is returned otherwise all the names for a street. (optional, default to false)
        majorRoads - Whether to include all roads in route calculation or just major roads. (optional, default to false)
        historicTrafficTimeBucket - Specifies whether routing calculation uses the historic traffic speeds. (optional, default to None)
        returnDirectionGeometry - Whether to include geometry associated with each route instruction in response. (optional, default to false)
        Returns:
        ApiResponse<GeoRouteResponse>
        Throws:
        ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

        Gets Route by Address (asynchronously) Routing Directions for Single and Multiple Origin & Destination Inputs. Accepts addresses as input and Returns Point-to-Point and Multi-Point travel directions by various travel modes.
        Parameters:
        startAddress - Starting address of the route. (required)
        endAddress - Ending address of the route. (required)
        db - Mode of commute. (optional, default to driving)
        country - Three digit ISO country code (optional, default to USA)
        intermediateAddresses - List of intermediate addresses of the route. (optional)
        oip - Specifies whether waypoints need to be optimized. (optional, default to false)
        destinationSrs - Specifies the desired coordinate system of the returned route. (optional)
        optimizeBy - Specifies whether the route should be optimized by time or distance. (optional, default to time)
        returnDistance - Specifies whether distance needs to be part of direction information in response. (optional, default to true)
        distanceUnit - Return Distance Unit such as ft(Foot), km(Kilometer), mi(Mile), m(Meter) or yd(Yard). (optional, default to m)
        returnTime - Specifies whether time needs to be part of direction information in response. (optional, default to true)
        timeUnit - Return time unit such as min(Minute), h(Hour), s(Second) or msec(Millisecond). (optional, default to min)
        language - Language of travel directions. (optional, default to en)
        directionsStyle - Specifies whether route directions text is to be returned in the response and in what detail (Normal or Terse). (optional, default to None)
        segmentGeometryStyle - Specifies whether the route geometry is to be returned in the response and in what detail (End or All). (optional, default to none)
        primaryNameOnly - If true then only the primary street name is returned otherwise all the names for a street. (optional, default to false)
        majorRoads - Whether to include all roads in route calculation or just major roads. (optional, default to false)
        historicTrafficTimeBucket - Specifies whether routing calculation uses the historic traffic speeds. (optional, default to None)
        returnDirectionGeometry - Whether to include geometry associated with each route instruction in response. (optional, default to false)
        callback - The callback to be executed when the API call finishes
        Returns:

        Throws:
        ApiException - If fail to process the API call, e.g. serializing the request body object

      • getRouteByLocation

        public GeoRouteResponse getRouteByLocation(java.lang.String startPoint,
                                  java.lang.String endPoint,
                                  java.lang.String db,
                                  java.lang.String intermediatePoints,
                                  java.lang.String oip,
                                  java.lang.String destinationSrs,
                                  java.lang.String optimizeBy,
                                  java.lang.String returnDistance,
                                  java.lang.String distanceUnit,
                                  java.lang.String returnTime,
                                  java.lang.String timeUnit,
                                  java.lang.String language,
                                  java.lang.String directionsStyle,
                                  java.lang.String segmentGeometryStyle,
                                  java.lang.String primaryNameOnly,
                                  java.lang.String majorRoads,
                                  java.lang.String historicTrafficTimeBucket,
                                  java.lang.String returnDirectionGeometry)
                                    throws ApiException
        Gets Route by Location Returns the fastest or shortest route based on a starting and ending location with optional intermediate points as input.
        Parameters:
        startPoint - Start Point in 'Lat,Long,coordsys' format (required)
        endPoint - End Point in 'Lat,Long,coordsys' format (required)
        db - Mode of commute. (optional, default to driving)
        intermediatePoints - List of intermediate points of the route. (optional)
        oip - Specifies whether waypoints need to be optimized. (optional, default to false)
        destinationSrs - Specifies the desired coordinate system of the returned route. (optional)
        optimizeBy - Specifies whether the route should be optimized by time or distance. (optional, default to time)
        returnDistance - Specifies whether distance needs to be part of direction information in response. (optional, default to true)
        distanceUnit - Return Distance Unit such as ft(Foot), km(Kilometer), mi(Mile), m(Meter) or yd(Yard). (optional, default to m)
        returnTime - Specifies whether time needs to be part of direction information in response. (optional, default to true)
        timeUnit - Return time unit such as min(Minute), h(Hour), s(Second) or msec(Millisecond). (optional, default to min)
        language - Specifies the language of travel directions. (optional, default to en)
        directionsStyle - Specifies whether route directions text is to be returned in the response and in what detail (Normal or Terse). (optional, default to None)
        segmentGeometryStyle - Specifies whether the route geometry is to be returned in the response and in what detail (End or All). (optional, default to none)
        primaryNameOnly - If true then only the primary street name is returned otherwise all the names for a street. (optional, default to false)
        majorRoads - Whether to include all roads in route calculation or just major roads. (optional, default to false)
        historicTrafficTimeBucket - Specifies whether routing calculation uses the historic traffic speeds. (optional, default to None)
        returnDirectionGeometry - Whether to include geometry associated with each route instruction in response. (optional, default to false)
        Returns:
        GeoRouteResponse
        Throws:
        ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

      • getTravelCostMatrixByAddress

        public TravelCostMatrixResponse getTravelCostMatrixByAddress(java.lang.String startAddresses,
                                                    java.lang.String endAddresses,
                                                    java.lang.String db,
                                                    java.lang.String country,
                                                    java.lang.String optimizeBy,
                                                    java.lang.String returnDistance,
                                                    java.lang.String destinationSrs,
                                                    java.lang.String distanceUnit,
                                                    java.lang.String returnTime,
                                                    java.lang.String timeUnit,
                                                    java.lang.String majorRoads,
                                                    java.lang.String returnOptimalRoutesOnly,
                                                    java.lang.String historicTrafficTimeBucket)
                                                      throws ApiException
        Gets Cost Matrix by Address Calculates the travel time and distances between an array of start and end addresses.
        Parameters:
        startAddresses - Start locations in text based addresses. (required)
        endAddresses - End locations in text based addresses. (required)
        db - Mode of commute. (optional, default to driving)
        country - 3 Digit ISO country code. (optional, default to USA)
        optimizeBy - Specifies the type of optimizing to use for the route (time/distance). (optional, default to time)
        returnDistance - Specifies whether to return the travel distance in the response or not. (optional, default to true)
        destinationSrs - Coordinate system used for the returned routes. (optional)
        distanceUnit - Return Distance Unit such as ft(Foot), km(Kilometer), mi(Mile), m(Meter) or yd(Yard). (optional, default to m)
        returnTime - Specifies whether to return the travel time in the response or not. (optional, default to true)
        timeUnit - Return time unit such as min(Minute), h(Hour), s(Second) or msec(Millisecond). (optional, default to min)
        majorRoads - Whether to include all roads in routes calculation or just major roads. (optional, default to false)
        returnOptimalRoutesOnly - Specifies whether to return only the optimized route for each start and end point combination. (optional, default to true)
        historicTrafficTimeBucket - Specifies whether routing calculation uses the historic traffic speeds. (optional, default to None)
        Returns:
        TravelCostMatrixResponse
        Throws:
        ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

      • getTravelCostMatrixByLocation

        public TravelCostMatrixResponse getTravelCostMatrixByLocation(java.lang.String startPoints,
                                                     java.lang.String endPoints,
                                                     java.lang.String db,
                                                     java.lang.String optimizeBy,
                                                     java.lang.String returnDistance,
                                                     java.lang.String destinationSrs,
                                                     java.lang.String distanceUnit,
                                                     java.lang.String returnTime,
                                                     java.lang.String timeUnit,
                                                     java.lang.String majorRoads,
                                                     java.lang.String returnOptimalRoutesOnly,
                                                     java.lang.String historicTrafficTimeBucket)
                                                       throws ApiException
        Gets Cost Matrix by Location GeoRoute's 'Travel Cost Matrix By Location' service calculates the travel time and distances between an array of start and end points based on location coordinates.
        Parameters:
        startPoints - The address to be searched. (required)
        endPoints - The address to be searched. (required)
        db - Mode of commute. (optional, default to driving)
        optimizeBy - Specifies whether routes should be optimized by time or distance. (optional, default to time)
        returnDistance - Specifies whether distance needs to be returned in response. (optional, default to true)
        destinationSrs - Specifies the desired coordinate system of returned routes. (optional)
        distanceUnit - Return Distance Unit such as ft(Foot), km(Kilometer), mi(Mile), m(Meter) or yd(Yard). (optional, default to m)
        returnTime - Specifies whether time needs to be returned in response. (optional, default to true)
        timeUnit - Return time unit such as min(Minute), h(Hour), s(Second) or msec(Millisecond). (optional, default to min)
        majorRoads - Whether to include all roads in routes calculation or just major roads. (optional, default to false)
        returnOptimalRoutesOnly - Specifies whether to return only the optimized route for each start and end point combination. (optional, default to true)
        historicTrafficTimeBucket - Specifies whether routing calculation uses the historic traffic speeds. (optional, default to None)
        Returns:
        TravelCostMatrixResponse
        Throws:
        ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body
